title: Suspect arrested, admits to shooting
content:
Dasure Taylor has been apprehended.
The New Castle Police Department announced on its Facebook page Tuesday night that it joined with the U.S. Marshals Western District of Pennsylvania Office in apprehending Taylor, 24, of 509 W. North St.
He had been wanted in connection of the attempted homicide of Darris Lane, 17, of New Castle, which occurred July 12 at Bolinger Playground, 616 W. North St.
Taylor was interrogated Tuesday by city police detectives, who said he admitted to shooting the victim.
He was arraigned and placed in the Lawrence County Jail on $100,000 bond. He also is being held on a detainer for state parole. U.S. Marshals also seized several firearms when apprehending Taylor. Charges for the recovered firearms are pending.
